newsitem.title: USA: JG Summit selects Carbide's Unipol process.
newsitem.headline: JG Summit selects Carbide's Unipol process.

text.p: Union Carbide Corp said Monday JG Summit Petrochemical Corp has obtained Unipol Process technology licenses to produce polyethylene and polypropylene at new facilities in Batangas City, Philippines.

The polyethylene unit will have capacity of 175,000 metric tonnes per year and produce linear low and high-density resins. Capacity of the polypropylene unit will be 180,000 tonnes for manufacture of homopolymers and random copolymers. Both are scheduled for completion in 1997's fourth quarter.
Carbide also said JG Summit named Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd as contractor for the project, and site preparation, infrastructure installation and preliminary structural work are under way.
